Name: EJB Bad Practices: Use of AWT Swing
Description: The product violates the Enterprise JavaBeans (EJB) specification by using AWT/Swing.
Extended Description: The Enterprise JavaBeans specification requires that every bean provider follow a set of programming guidelines designed to ensure that the bean will be portable and behave consistently in any EJB container. In this case, the product violates the following EJB guideline: An enterprise bean must not use the AWT functionality to attempt to output information to a display, or to input information from a keyboard. The specification justifies this requirement in the following way: Most servers do not allow direct interaction between an application program and a keyboard/display attached to the server system.
Potential Mitigations: ::PHASE:Architecture and Design:DESCRIPTION:Do not use AWT/Swing when writing EJBs.::
Taxonomy Mappings: ::TAXONOMY NAME:Software Fault Patterns:ENTRY ID:SFP3:ENTRY NAME:Use of an improper API::
